title: MR. MASON'S TRUNK
style_prefix: Children's book illustration, warm painterly style with soft brush strokes. NO TEXT IN IMAGE.

character_refs.layla: Layla - girl with curly dark brown hair, yellow bow on top, teal hoodie with golden sun design
character_refs.riley: Riley - girl with straight dark hair, pink bow, purple dress with white stars
character_refs.ellis: Ellis - boy with blonde hair, blue eyes, orange and blue soccer jersey
character_refs.benny: Benny - friendly brown teddy bear character wearing green plaid scarf
character_refs.mr_mason: Mr. Mason - elderly African American man with gray hair, glasses, blue cardigan, wise gentle expression, walks with cane

scenes.script: The friends went to Mr. Mason's house. He was sitting on his porch. 'Hello!' he said. 'I need help in my attic. Can you help me reach high things?'
scenes.prompt: Four friends arriving at Mr. Mason's cozy house. Mr. Mason sitting on porch in rocking chair, waving hello. Warm welcoming scene, well-kept house with character.

scenes.script: They went inside his house. It was cozy and warm. There were photos on the walls. There were maps and little things from far away.
scenes.prompt: Inside Mr. Mason's living room. Walls covered with framed photos, old maps, travel mementos. Cozy warm lighting. Friends looking around with wonder. Rich with history.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason took them to a ladder. It went up to the attic. Dust floated in the light. 'I haven't been up here in a long time,' he said.
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason pointing to attic ladder. Dusty light streaming down from above. Friends looking up curiously. Anticipation of discovery. Dust motes visible in light beam.

scenes.script: The attic was full of boxes. Old things were everywhere. Sunlight came through a little window. 'Wow!' said Layla. 'It's like a museum!'
scenes.prompt: Attic filled with boxes, old furniture, mysterious covered shapes. Golden sunlight through small window. Four friends looking around in awe. Dust and wonder.

scenes.script: They helped Mr. Mason clean. He told them what to keep and what to throw away. 'That can stay. That can go.' It was normal work.
scenes.prompt: Friends helping Mr. Mason sort boxes in attic. Mr. Mason directing, pointing to items. Normal organizing work. Boxes being moved and sorted.

scenes.script: Ellis found something in the corner. It was a big old trunk! It had stickers from all over the world. 'Mr. Mason!' said Ellis. 'What is this big thing?'
scenes.prompt: Ellis discovering a large vintage trunk in corner of attic. Trunk covered with travel stickers from many countries. Ellis calling out, pointing excitedly at the trunk.

scenes.script: Everyone came to look. Mr. Mason's face got soft and happy. He touched the trunk gently. 'My old traveling trunk,' he said.
scenes.prompt: All four friends and Mr. Mason gathered around the old trunk. Mr. Mason touching it with gentle nostalgia, soft expression. Friends watching his reaction with curiosity.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason opened the trunk slowly. Inside were wrapped objects. There were old photos too. 'Every object in here is a memory,' he said.
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason opening the trunk, friends leaning in to see. Inside visible: wrapped objects, old photographs, treasures. Magical moment of discovery. Warm attic light.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason took out a small bag. It had spices inside. He smelled them and smiled. 'This is from Morocco,' he said.
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason holding a small cloth bag of spices, smelling it with eyes closed and nostalgic smile. Friends watching intently. Warm colors suggesting spice aromas.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason's eyes looked far away. He was remembering. 'There were stalls everywhere,' he said. 'Spices in every color. Men selling things and calling out.'
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason with distant remembering expression, still holding spices. Subtle visual suggestion of Moroccan market colors swirling faintly in background. Friends listening raptly.

scenes.script: 'You can look inside,' said Mr. Mason. 'But be careful. These things are special.' The friends looked in the trunk.
scenes.prompt: Four friends carefully reaching into the trunk, examining wrapped objects. Mr. Mason watching with gentle approval. Reverent handling of treasured items.

scenes.script: Riley found a little wooden fish. 'That's from Japan,' said Mr. Mason. 'I saw a fish sale there. I learned about prices.'
scenes.prompt: Riley holding a small carved wooden fish, examining it with wonder. Mr. Mason explaining its origin. Delicate Japanese fish carving in her hands.

scenes.script: Benny found a wooden stamp with pretty patterns. 'That's for making bread,' said Mr. Mason. 'It's from Italy. A family bakery.'
scenes.prompt: Benny holding an ornate wooden bread stamp with decorative patterns. Turning it over to see the carved design. Mr. Mason smiling at the memory.

scenes.script: Ellis found a tiny net. 'That's from a fishing village,' said Mr. Mason. 'I helped sell fish there one morning.'
scenes.prompt: Ellis examining a small decorative fishing net. Delicate handmade netting. Mr. Mason explaining with animated gestures about the fishing village.

scenes.script: Layla found a wooden star. It was very pretty. 'That's from Germany,' said Mr. Mason. 'From a Christmas market. Snow and lights and handmade gifts.'
scenes.prompt: Layla holding up a beautiful carved wooden star ornament. Light catching its details. Mr. Mason describing German Christmas market. Magical feeling.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason looked at the friends. 'These are not just old things,' he said. 'They have lessons inside. I was waiting to share them with the right people.'
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason sitting with the open trunk, looking warmly at the four friends. Meaningful moment. Friends looking honored and eager. Connection between generations.

scenes.script: The friends got excited. 'Will you tell us the stories?' asked Layla. 'Please!' said Benny. They all wanted to hear about the things in the trunk.
scenes.prompt: Four friends leaning forward eagerly, excited expressions. Layla and Benny asking, pleading to hear stories. Mr. Mason looking pleased at their enthusiasm.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason smiled. 'One story at a time,' he said. He held up the spice bag. 'Let's start with Morocco. That's where our journey begins.'
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason holding up the spice bag, beginning his story. Friends settling in to listen. Attic transformed into cozy storytelling space. Anticipation.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason started to talk about Morocco. Something magical seemed to happen. The attic felt different. Colors and sounds seemed to appear.
scenes.prompt: Magical transition moment. Mr. Mason speaking, Moroccan colors and patterns starting to swirl subtly around the attic. Warm oranges, reds, golds appearing. Friends mesmerized.

scenes.script: The friends sat around the trunk. They were ready to learn. Mr. Mason would teach them about markets around the world.
scenes.prompt: Friends seated in circle around the open trunk with Mr. Mason. Warm golden light. Ready to embark on journey of stories. Moroccan colors beginning to shimmer.
